children.name: ward
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 8.Ward

children.name: community
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 9.Community

children.name: facility_name
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 10. Facility Name

children.name: facility_address
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 11. Street Address (Number and Street)

children.name: facility_id
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 12. Health Facility ID

children.name: private_yn
children.label: 13. Is this a private health facility?

children.name: facility_type
children.label: 14. What type of facility is this?

children.name: facility_owner_manager
children.label: 15. Who owns or manages this facility?

children.name: facility_owner_manager_other
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 15.1. Please specify owner or manager of this facility.

children.name: road_yn
children.label: 16. Is there at least one road within 100 meters of this health facility that is large or wide enough to allow a vehicle to pass?

children.name: road_type
children.label: 17. Please select the main type of road that is within 100m of this location.

children.name: road_type_other_specify
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 17.1 Please specify other road type

children.name: all_weather_road_yn
children.label: 18. Can the road to the health facility be used all the time, even during the rainy season?

children.name: transport_to_referral
children.label: 19. What type(s) of emergency transport is most used to transport/take people to the referral health facility?

children.name: grid_proximity
children.label: 20. How close do you estimate that the power lines of the electricity grid (like NEPA or PHCN) are to this location?

children.name: grid_within_500_m
children.label: Grid is within 500 meters of this location (but does not connect)

children.name: local_grid_proximity
children.label: 21. If there is another grid (a local mini-grid) how close do you estimate that the power lines of this local electricity grid are to this location?

children.name: local_grid_within_500_m
children.label: Mini-grid is within 500 meters of this location (but does not connect)

children.name: dk
children.label: Information not available  or  Don’t know

children.name: power_sources
children.label: 22. What type(s) of power sources are available at this facility?

children.name: generator_funct_yn
children.label: 23.1 Is the generator connected and functional?

children.name: solar_funct_yn
children.label: 23.2 Is the solar system connected and functional?

children.name: grid_funct_yn
children.label: 23.3 Is the Grid or power (like PHCN, NEPA) connected and functional?

children.name: days_no_electricity
children.hint: Enter a number between 0 and 31. Do not leave blank. Enter 999 if the information is not available. If the facility had power every single day in the last month please enter 0.
children.label: 24. How many days in the last month was the facility without electricity or power from any source?

bind.jr:constraintMsg: The number entered must be lower than 31.

children.name: vaccine_storage_yn
children.label: 25. Do you store vaccines in the facility?

children.name: yes
children.label: Yes, we store vaccines in this facility

children.name: no_stored_other_palce
children.label: No, vaccines are in cold store somewhere else and brought only when needed

children.name: no_vaccines_not_offered
children.label: No, facility does not offer vaccination

children.name: vaccine_storage_type_other
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 26.1 Please specify where do you store vaccines.

children.name: cold_storage_system_type
children.label: 27. Is there an independent power source for the refridgerator or freezer?

children.name: cold_storage_system_type_other
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 27.1 Please specify other type of power.

children.name: days_vaccines_strg_wo_power
children.label: 28. How long has the cold storage system been without power in the last six months?

children.name: always_power
children.label: The cold storage system has always had power

children.name: water_sources
children.label: 29. Is there a water source less than 100 meters away from the facility or within the compound/premises?

children.name: none
children.label: No water source within 100 meters of the facility or within the premise/compound

children.name: surface_water
children.label: Surface water such as pond/ lake/ river/ stream

children.name: days_no_potable_water_pastmth
children.hint: Enter a number between 0 and 31. Do not leave blank. Enter 999 if the information is not available. If the facility had power every single day in the last month please enter 0.
children.label: 30. How many days in the past month was the facility without POTABLE/SAFE DRINKING water from any of the above sources?

children.name: building_condition
children.label: 31. Do not read the next question aloud. Respond to the question based on your own observation of the health facility buildings: How would you describe how a majority of the health facility buildings look?

children.name: facility_construction_responsible
children.label: 32. Who was responsible for the original construction of the facility?

children.name: localngocivilsociety
children.label: Local NGO or Civil Society Organization

children.name: mdgconditionalgrants
children.label: MDGs Conditional Grants Scheme (joint Federal and State Government initiative)

children.name: toilets_yn
children.label: 33. Are there any type of toilets available on the premises?

children.name: note_toilets_available
children.hint: If there are no toilets for that type write “0” for that option. Please enter the number for all types available at the facility.
children.label: 33.1 How many of each type of toilet are on the premises?

children.name: num_flush_or_pour_flush_piped
children.label: Flush or water toilet going into piped water system, to septic tank or to pit latrine

children.name: flush_improved_functional_yn
children.hint: Functional means that the toilet functioned for at least 7 days in the last month.
children.label: 34.1 Are the flush or water or pour flush (to piped water system, to septic tank, to pit) toilets functional?

children.name: flush_unimproved_functional_yn
children.hint: Functional means that the toilet functioned for at least 7 days in the last month.
children.label: 34.2 Are the other flush or water or pour flush toilets functional?

children.name: vip_latrine_functional_yn
children.hint: Functional means that the toilet functioned for at least 7 days in the last month.
children.label: 34.3 Are the ventilated improved pit latrines functional?

children.name: slab_pit_latrine_functional_yn
children.hint: Functional means that the toilet functioned for at least 7 days in the last month.
children.label: 34.4 Are the pit latrines with slab functional?

children.name: open_pit_latrine_functional_yn
children.hint: Functional means that the toilet functioned for at least 7 days in the last month.
children.label: 34.5 Are the pit latrines without slab or open pit functional?

children.name: bucket_system_functional_yn
children.hint: Functional means that the toilet functioned for at least 7 days in the last month.
children.label: 34.6 Is the bucket system functional?

children.name: note_waste_disposal
children.label: 35. I would like to know how the facility disposes of medical/biological waste.

children.name: sharps_separated_yn
children.label: Sharps are disposed of in a pit OR collected and disposed elsewhere.

children.name: phone_signal_strength
children.hint: Select ONLY one. Evaluate network signal strength where it is strongest, while still remaining within the premises of the health facility.
children.label: 36. Choose one of the following to describe the STRONGEST mobile phone signal network at this point (in case there is more than one network).

children.name: no_signal
children.label: None (No useable network coverage for voice calls)

children.name: low_signal_strength
children.label: Low (signal is weak or intermittent; calls often dropped)

children.name: high_signal_strength
children.label: High (signal is strong and consistent; dropped calls are rare

children.name: info_tech_available
children.label: 37. Which of the following are available at this health facility?

children.name: mobile_facility
children.label: At least one mobile phone owned by the health facility

children.name: mobile_staff
children.label: A mobile phone owned by a staff member

children.name: credit
children.label: Mobile phone credit/charge cards provided to health facility staff for work use

children.name: info_tech_functional_mobile_facility
children.label: 38.2 Is at least one mobile phone owned by the health facility currently functional?

children.name: info_tech_functional_mobile_staff
children.label: 38.3 Is at least one mobile phone owned by a staff member currently functional?

children.name: note_medical_staff_posted
children.hint: Enter a number. Do not leave blank. Enter 999 if the information is not available.
children.label: 39. How many of the following staff are posted at this facility?

children.name: num_junior_chews_posted
children.label: Junior CHEWS (junior community health extension workers)

children.name: note_medical_staff_active
children.hint: Enter a number. Do not leave blank. Enter 999 if the information is not available.
children.label: 40. Of the posted staff, how many were here at least 3 days every week in the last one month?

children.name: num_junior_chews_active
children.label: Junior CHEWS (junior community health extension workers)

children.name: midwivery_service_scheme_yn
children.label: 41. Are any of the midwives posted from the Midwifery Service Scheme (MMS) run by the National Primary Healthcare Development Agency?

children.name: delivery_services_yn
children.label: 42. Does this facility provide delivery services?

children.name: delivery_skilled_birth_247_yn
children.label: 43. Does this facility provide delivery services with a skilled birth attendant (doctor, midwife, nurse-midwife) 24 hours a day, 7 days a week?

children.name: delivery_staff_csection_yn
children.label: 44. Does this facility have someone on staff who is able to perform cesarean sections?

children.name: facility_open_247_yn
children.label: 45. Can this facility provide delivery services 24 hours a day, 7 days a week?

children.name: staff_quarters_yn
children.label: 46. Are there any staff living quarters?

children.name: staff_paid_1mths_yn
children.label: 47. Were all salaried staff members paid their wages last month?

children.name: staff_paid_3mths_yn
children.label: 48. Were all salaried staff members paid in the last three months?

children.name: malaria_treatment_artemisinin
children.hint: Malaria treatment and prevention is giving medication or providing preventive measures (such as mosquito nets). Select ONLY one.
children.label: 49. Does the facility provide artemisinin-based combination treatment (ACT) for malaria treatment?

children.name: tb_treatment_yn
children.label: 50. Does the facility provide tuberculosis treatment?

children.name: antenatal_care_yn
children.hint: This includes services for pregnant women, educating them on how to take care of themselves, monitoring progress of the pregnancy etc.Select ONLY one.
children.label: 51. Does the facility provide antenatal care services?

children.name: note_antenatal_care_services
children.label: 51.1 Does the facility provide the following antenatal care services?

children.name: antenatal_care_physical_exam
children.label: Physical exams, including measuring weight, measuring blood pressure and assessing how many weeks the woman has been pregnant

children.name: antenatal_care_malaria_prlx
children.label: Sulphadoxine-Pyrimethamine (SP/Fansidar) for prevention of malaria during pregnancy

children.name: emergency_obstetrics_yn
children.hint: This includes giving specific types of antibiotics via IV or injections, giving medication to induce labor and increase contractions, giving medication to ease high blood pressure and fluid retention, being able to manually remove the placenta and assist with a regular delivery. Select ONLY one.
children.label: 52. Does the facility provide basic emergency obstetric care?

children.name: note_emergency_antenatal
children.label: 52.1 Does the facility provide any of the following basic emergency obstetric care?

children.name: emoc_vacuum_extractor_yn
children.label: Assisted vaginal delivery with manual vacuum extractor or forceps

children.name: emoc_sba_placenta_removal_yn
children.label: Skilled birth attendant who is able to perform manual removal of placenta or retained parts

children.name: c_section_yn
children.label: 53. Does the facility provide caesarean sections?

children.name: note_cesarean_section
children.label: 54. Does the facility regularly have or provide the following?

children.name: compr_oc_access_safe_blood
children.label: Access to safe blood and storage?

children.name: compr_oc_anesthesia_machine
children.label: Perform spinal anesthesia or general anesthesia

children.name: family_planning_yn
children.hint: This includes services to help people manage when they get pregnant and how many children they will have etc. by providing advice, birth control/contraceptives. Select ONLY one.
children.label: 55. Does the facility provide family planning services?

children.name: note_family_planning
children.label: 56. Does the facility regularly have or provide the following?

children.name: inpatient_care_yn
children.hint: This includes beds for patients to stay overnight and having staff to provide care all day and all night for patients who stay overnight. Select ONLY one.
children.label: 57. Does the facility provide inpatient care?

children.name: inpatient_care_num_beds
children.hint: Enter a number. Do not leave blank. Enter 999 if the information is not available.
children.label: 57.1 Number of beds

children.name: laboratory_yn
children.label: 58. Is there a laboratory at this facility?

children.name: lab_tests
children.label: 60. Which of the following laboratory tests are performed in this health facility?

children.name: staff_outreach_particip_yn
children.label: 61. Do the health facility staff conduct community health education and sensitization campaigns on a regular basis?

children.name: equipment
children.label: 62. Do you have this equipment at this health facility?

children.name: aspirator
children.label: Manual vacuum aspirator/karman syringe (for management of post abortion care)

children.name: compr_oc_suction_machine
children.label: Suction aspirator or suction bulb for newborns

children.name: aspirator_funct_yn
children.label: Manual vacuum aspirator/karman syringe (for management of post abortion care)

children.name: suction_funct_yn
children.label: Suction aspirator or suction bulb for newborns

children.name: supplies
children.label: 64. Which of the following supplies are available at the facility?

children.name: insecticide_treated_bednets
children.label: Insecticide treated bednets (for distribution to the community)

children.name: medication
children.label: 65. Which of the following classes of medications are available at this facility?

children.name: note_medication_out_of_stock
children.label: 66. Did the facility experience a stock-out on any of these items in the last three months?

children.name: supplements
children.label: 67. Which of the following nutritional supplements are available at this facility?

children.name: note_supplements_out_of_stock
children.label: 68. Did the facility experience a stock-out of the item in the last three months?

children.name: immunization
children.label: 69. Which of the following routine immunizations are available at this facility?

children.name: note_immunization_out_of_stock
children.label: 70. Did the facility experience a stock-out of the item in the last three months?

children.name: adult_tx_fees_yn
children.label: 71. Are fees charged for any type of treatment for adults?

children.name: fees_adults
children.label: 72. Please check all the fees that are charged.

children.name: child_tx_fees_yn
children.label: 73. Are fees charged for any type of treatment for children?

children.name: fees_children
children.label: 74. Please check all the fees that are charged.

children.name: note_health_insurance
children.label: 75. Is the facility participating in a health insurance or free healthcare scheme?

children.name: other_health_insurance_specify
children.hint: Enter text. Do not leave blank. Enter XXX if the information is not available.
children.label: 75.1 Please specify type of health insurance.
